div.head: [tei] Declarations for classes, datatypes, and macros available to all TEI modules

row.cell: provides attributes for elements representing speech or action that can be ascribed to a specific individual.
提供的元素屬性代表言詞或行為，可出自某一特定個人。
@who
indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.
指出該元素內容所歸屬的個人或團體。
provides attributes describing the nature of any physical damage affecting a reading.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides attributes describing the nature of any physical damage affecting a reading.

row.cell: @extent
indicates approximately how much text is in the damaged area, in letters, minims, inches, or any appropriate unit, where this cannot be deduced from the contents of the tag.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for indicates approximately how much text is in the damaged area, in letters, minims, inches, or any appropriate unit, where this cannot be deduced from the contents of the tag.

row.cell: @hand
In the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand, signifies the hand responsible for the damage.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for In the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand, signifies the hand responsible for the damage.

row.cell: @agent
categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.

row.cell: damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges

cell.hi: No zh-tw for damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges

row.cell: damage results from mildew on the leaf surface

cell.hi: No zh-tw for damage results from mildew on the leaf surface

row.cell: damage results from smoke

cell.hi: No zh-tw for damage results from smoke

row.cell: @degree

Signifies the degree of damage according to a convenient scale. The damage tag with the degree attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; text supplied from other sources should be tagged as supplied.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for Signifies the degree of damage according to a convenient scale. The damage tag with the degree attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; text supplied from other sources should be tagged as supplied.

row.cell: @group
assigns an arbitrary number to each stretch of damage regarded as forming part of the same physical phenomenon.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for assigns an arbitrary number to each stretch of damage regarded as forming part of the same physical phenomenon.

row.cell: provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain dates, times, or datable events.
提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the W3C datatypes.
提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含以W3C datatypes所定義的日期明確之事件。
@period
supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.

row.cell: @when
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.

row.cell: @notBefore
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
以標準格式說明該事件可能發生的最早日期，例如年-月-日。
@notAfter
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
以標準形式標明該事件可能的最晚日期，例如年-月-日。
@from
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
以標準格式表示該段時間的起始點。
@to
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
以標準格式表示該段時間的結束點。
provides attributes for those elements in the TEI Header which may be independently selected by means of the special purpose decls attribute.
提供屬性，用於TEI標頭內可單獨以特殊目的的屬性decls選出的元素。
@default
indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.
當父元素被選擇時，指出此元素是否會被選擇。
This element is selected if its parent is selected
若父元素被選擇，則此元素會被選擇。
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.
此元素僅能被明確選擇，若此元素為其類別中之唯一，則父元素被選擇時，此元素會被選擇。
provides attributes for elements which may be independently associated with a particular declarable element within the header, thus overriding the inherited default for that element.
提供元素屬性，這些元素可單獨與標頭中一特定可宣告元素相關連，因此超越該特定元素本身的預設值。
@decls
identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.
指明標頭內一個或多個可宣告元素，可應用於帶有此屬性與內容的元素上。
provides attributes for describing the size of physical objects.
提供符合某種度量值的屬性值。
@unit
names the unit used for the measurement
度量單位的名稱。
centimetres
公分
millimetres
公釐
inches
英吋
lines of text

cell.hi: No zh-tw for lines of text

row.cell: characters
characters of text

cell.hi: No zh-tw for characters of text

row.cell: @quantity
specifies the length in the units specified

cell.hi: No zh-tw for specifies the length in the units specified

row.cell: @scope
specifies the applicability of this measurement, where more than one object is being measured.
測量多個物件時，標明此度量的可應用範圍。
measurement applies to all instances.
度量可應用於所有實例。
measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.
度量可應用於大部分實例。
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.
度量僅應用於特定範圍的實例。
provides attributes common to all elements which behave in the same way as divisions.
提供一組屬性，通用於所有與區段作用相 同的元素。
@org
organization
specifies how the content of the division is organized.
說明該區段內容的組合方式。
composite content: i.e. no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.
複合內容：未說明此區段目前內容的處理順序或相互關係。
uniform content: i.e. the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.
一致內容：此區段目前的內容形成一個邏輯單位，且會依序處理。
@sample
indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.
指出此區段是否為來源文件的樣本，若為樣本，則說明出自哪一部分。
division lacks material present at end in source.
區段的末端無資料
division lacks material at start and end.
區段的起始與末端無資料
division lacks material at start.
區段的起始部分無資料
position of sampled material within original unknown.
來源文件中的樣本資料位置不明
division is not a sample.
區段非樣本
@part
specifies whether or not the division is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas.
說明該區段是否被其他結構性元素切割，例如一段話語被兩個或多個詩節分開。
yes
該區段某些方面不完整
the division is incomplete in some respect
該區段某些方面不完整
no
該區段完整，或者未說明其完整性。
either the division is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness.
該區段完整，或者未說明其完整性。
initial
不完整區段的起始部分
the initial part of an incomplete division
不完整區段的起始部分
medial
不完整區段的中段部分
a medial part of an incomplete division
不完整區段的中段部分
final
不完整區段的末端部分
the final part of an incomplete division
不完整區段的末端部分
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations.
用於記錄時間長度規格化的屬性
@dur
duration
時間長度
indicates the length of this element in time.
指明此元素的時間長度。
provides attributes describing the nature of a encoded scholarly intervention or interpretation of any kind.
提供屬性，描述任何已標記的學者更正或詮釋的性質。
@cert
certainty
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.
表示該更動或詮釋的相關正確度。
@resp
responsible party
indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.
指出負責該更動或詮釋的代理者，例如編輯或轉錄者。
@evidence
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation.
指出支持該更動或詮釋可信度或正確性的證明
there is internal evidence to support the intervention.
有內部證明得以支持
there is external evidence to support the intervention.
有外部證明得以支持
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.
編輯、編目者或學者根據自身的專業來執行該更動或詮釋。
@source
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which support the given reading.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which support the given reading.

row.cell: provides attributes common to all elements in the TEI encoding scheme.
提供一組屬性，通用於TEI編碼標準中的所有元素。
@xml:id
identifier
provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.
提供一個獨特識別符碼，識別帶有該屬性的元素。
@n
number
gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.
將元素標上一個數字 (或其他標號)，該標號在文件中未必是獨特的。
@xml:lang
language
indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47
使用RFC3066的代碼，指出該元素內容的使用語言
@rend
rendition
indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.
指出該元素如何呈現於來源文件中
@rendition
points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.

row.cell: @xml:base
provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.
提供一個基礎統一資源識別符 (URI) 參照，可將相對統一資源識別符參照轉變為絕對統一資源識別符參照。
provides attributes describing aspects of the hand in which a manuscript is written.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides attributes describing aspects of the hand in which a manuscript is written.

row.cell: @scribe
gives a standard name or other identifier for the scribe believed to be responsible for this hand.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for gives a standard name or other identifier for the scribe believed to be responsible for this hand.

row.cell: @script
characterizes the particular script or writing style used by this hand, for example secretary, copperplate, Chancery, Italian, etc.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for characterizes the particular script or writing style used by this hand, for example secretary, copperplate, Chancery, Italian, etc.

row.cell: @medium
describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil

cell.hi: No zh-tw for describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil

row.cell: @scope
specifies how widely this hand is used in the manuscript.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for specifies how widely this hand is used in the manuscript.

row.cell: only this hand is used throughout the manuscript

cell.hi: No zh-tw for only this hand is used throughout the manuscript

row.cell: this hand is used through most of the manuscript

cell.hi: No zh-tw for this hand is used through most of the manuscript

row.cell: this hand is used occasionally in the manuscript

cell.hi: No zh-tw for this hand is used occasionally in the manuscript

row.cell: provides attributes for specifying the type of a computer resource using a standard taxonomy.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides attributes for specifying the type of a computer resource using a standard taxonomy.

row.cell: @mimeType
MIME media type

cell.hi: No zh-tw for MIME media type

row.cell: specifies the applicable multimedia internet mail extension (MIME) media type
MIME協定種類
provides attributes for elements which represent a formal analysis or interpretation.
提供元素的屬性，這些元素代表一正式分析或詮釋。
@resp
responsible party
indicates who is responsible for the interpretation.
指出該詮釋的負責人。
@type
indicates what kind of phenomenon is being noted in the passage.
指出段落中所註解的現象類別。
identifies an image in the passage.
標明段落中的影像。
identifies a character associated with the passage.
標明與段落相關聯的人物。
identifies a theme in the passage.
標明段落中的主題。
identifies an allusion to another text.
標明另一個文本的引用。
@inst
instances
points to instances of the analysis or interpretation represented by the current element.
連結到目前元素所代表的分析或解釋。
provides attributes to represent a regularized or normalized measurement.
提供屬性，代表一般化或規格化的度量。
@unit
indicates the units used for the measurement, usually using the standard symbol for the desired units.
指出度量單位，通常以標準符號表示
metre
公尺
SI base unit of length
SI基礎長度單位
kilogram
公斤
SI base unit of mass
SI基礎質量單位
second
秒
SI base unit of time
SI基礎時間單位
hertz
赫茲
SI unit of frequency
SI頻率單位
pascal
Pascal
SI unit of pressure or stress
SI壓力單位
ohm
Ω歐姆
SI unit of electric resistance
SI 電阻單位
litre
公升
1 dm³
1dm³
tonne
公噸
10³ kg
10³ 公斤
hectare
公頃
1 hm²
ångström
埃格斯特朗 (單位)
10⁻¹⁰ m
10⁻¹⁰ 公尺
millilitre
毫升
centimetre
公分
decibel
分貝
see remarks, below
分貝
kilobit
10³ or 1000 bits
10³或1000 位元
kibibit
2¹⁰ or 1024 bits
2¹⁰或1024 位元
kilobyte
10³ or 1000 bytes
10³或1000位元組
kibibyte
2¹⁰ or 1024 bytes
2¹⁰或1024位元組
megabyte
10⁶ or 1 000 000 bytes
mebibyte
2²⁰ or 1 048 576 bytes
2²⁰或1 048 576位元組
@quantity
specifies the number of the specified units that comprise the measurement
標明包含該度量的特定單位數目
@commodity
indicates the substance that is being measured
指出所度量的物品。
provides attributes common to elements which refer to named persons, places, organizations etc.
提供屬性，通用於參照到人物、地點、組織等的元素。
@key
provides an external means of locating a full definition for the entity (or entities) being named, such as a database record key or other token.
提供一種方法，搜尋已命名實體的完整定義，比如使用資料庫record key或一個統一資源識別符 (URI)
@ref
reference
provides an explicit means of locating a full definition for the entity being named by means of a URI.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides an explicit means of locating a full definition for the entity being named by means of a URI.

row.cell: @nymRef
reference to the canonical name

cell.hi: No zh-tw for reference to the canonical name

row.cell: provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object named by the element bearing it.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides a means of locating the canonical form (nym) of the names associated with the object named by the element bearing it.

row.cell: attributes for components of personal names
用於個人名稱元件的屬性
common attributes for those elements which form part of a personal name.
構成部分個人名稱的元素所用之通用屬性
@full
indicates whether the name component is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial.
指出所提供的名稱元件是否完整，為一縮寫或僅為一字首字母。
the name component is spelled out in full.
該名稱元件的拼字完整。
abbreviated
該名稱元件為縮寫形式。
the name component is given in an abbreviated form.
該名稱元件為縮寫形式。
initial letter
該名稱元件僅以一字首字母表示。
the name component is indicated only by one initial.
該名稱元件僅以一字首字母表示。
@sort
specifies the sort order of the name component in relation to others within the personal name.
指明個人名稱中該名稱元件與其他元件之間的排列順序。
provides attributes for describing where on the source page or object a textual element appears.
提供屬性，描述文件元素在來源頁面或物件上出現的位置。
@place
below the line
行底
bottom margin
頁尾空白處
in the bottom margin
頁尾空白處
left margin
頁左方空白處
in the left margin
頁左方空白處
right margin
頁右方空白處
in the right margin
頁右方空白處
top margin
頁首空白處
in the top margin
頁首空白處
on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
對頁頁面
on the other side of the leaf
書頁反頁頁面
above the line
行上方
on verso of the sheet or page
紙張反頁頁面
apparatus
註腳出現於頁腳的學術編輯註解中
note appears in the apparatus at the foot of the page.
註腳出現於頁腳的學術編輯註解中
note appears at end of chapter or volume.
註解出現於章節或書冊的結尾
note appears at foot of page.
註解出現於頁腳
note appears as a marked paragraph in the body of the text.
註解以已標記的段落形式，出現於正文部分。
note appears between lines of the text; a less precise form of either infralinear or supralinear.
註解出現於行間；相較於屬性值infralinear或supralinear，此格式用法較不精確
addition is made in a space left in the witness by an earlier scribe.
註解以已標記的段落形式，出現於正文部分。
one or more of the other values
一個或多個其他屬性值
provides attributes for elements used for arbitrary segmentation.
提供屬性，用於有隨機分割功用的元素。
@type
characterizes the type of segment.
描述分割類型。
@function
characterizes the function of the segment.
描述該分割的功能。
@part
specifies whether or not the segment is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a clause which is divided between two or more sentences.
說明該分割段落是否被其他結構性元素所切割，例如一個子句被兩個或多個句子分開。
yes
該分割的某些方面不完整
the segment is incomplete in some respect
該分割的某些方面不完整
no
該分割完整，或者未說明其完整性
either the segment is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
該分割完整，或者未說明其完整性
initial
不完整分割的起始部分
the initial part of an incomplete segment
不完整分割的起始部分
medial
不完整分割的中段部分
a medial part of an incomplete segment
不完整分割的中段部分
final
不完整分割的末端部分
the final part of an incomplete segment
不完整分割的末端部分
provides attributes for elements which delimit a span of text by pointing mechanisms rather than by enclosing it.
提供元素的屬性，這些元素使用參照機制來限定某一文字段，而非包含此文字段。
@spanTo
indicates the end of a span initiated by the element bearing this attribute.
指出文字段的結尾，該文字段以帶有此屬性的元素開頭。
provides attributes used to decorate rows or cells of a table.
提供屬性，用以裝飾表格內的儲存格或列。
@role
indicates the kind of information held in this cell or in each cell of this row.
指出此儲存格或列當中，各儲存格所包含的資訊類型。
labelling or descriptive information only.
僅為標號或描述性資訊。
data values.
數據值。
@rows
indicates the number of rows occupied by this cell or row.
指出此儲存格或列所占的列數。
@cols
columns
indicates the number of columns occupied by this cell or row.
指出此儲存格或列所佔的欄位數。
provides attributes common to those elements which have a duration in time, expressed either absolutely or by reference to an alignment map.
提供一組屬性，通用於帶有時間長度的元素，這些元素以絕對方式表明，或是參照到組序表。
@start
indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element begins.
指出時間組序中此元素的起始位置。
@end
indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element ends.
指出時間組序 (順序點) 中此元素的結尾位置。
provides attributes specific to elements encoding authorial or scribal intervention in a text when transcribing manuscript or similar sources.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for provides attributes specific to elements encoding authorial or scribal intervention in a text when transcribing manuscript or similar sources.

row.cell: @hand
signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for signifies the hand of the agent which made the intervention.

row.cell: @status

indicates the effect of the intervention, for example in the case of a deletion, strikeouts which include too much or too little text, or in the case of an addition, an insertion which duplicates some of the text already present.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for indicates the effect of the intervention, for example in the case of a deletion, strikeouts which include too much or too little text, or in the case of an addition, an insertion which duplicates some of the text already present.

row.cell: all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original, whether the duplication is word-for-word or less exact.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original, whether the duplication is word-for-word or less exact.

row.cell: part of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original

cell.hi: No zh-tw for part of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original

row.cell: some text at the beginning of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for some text at the beginning of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.

row.cell: some text at the end of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for some text at the end of the deletion is marked as deleted even though it clearly should not be deleted.

row.cell: some text at the beginning of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for some text at the beginning of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

row.cell: some text at the end of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for some text at the end of the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

row.cell: some text in the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for some text in the deletion is not marked as deleted even though it clearly should be.

row.cell: the deletion is not faulty.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for the deletion is not faulty.

row.cell: @seq
sequence
assigns a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for assigns a sequence number related to the order in which the encoded features carrying this attribute are believed to have occurred.

row.cell: provides attributes used to indicate the status of a translatable portion of an ODD document.
提供的屬性指出ODD文件中可翻譯部分的狀態。
@version
specifies the version name or number of the source from which the translated version was derived
說明該翻譯版本來源的版本名稱或版本數
provides attributes which can be used to classify or subclassify elements in any way.
提供可依任何方法將元素分類或次要分類的一般屬性。
@type
characterizes the element in some sense, using any convenient classification scheme or typology.
用合適的分類標準或類型來描述該元素。

若有需要，提供該元素的次要分類
groups TEI elements for which it is reasonable to specify whitespace management using the W3C-defined xml:space attribute.

signals an intention that white space should be preserved by applications

定義的屬性值範圍說明預定呈現在網路上之物件大小
regular expression pattern

定義的屬性值範圍以固定方法表示

定義的屬性值範圍用以識別人類或動物的性別

defines the range of attribute values expressing a temporal expression such as a date, a time, or a combination of them, that conform to the international standard Data elements and interchange formats – Information interchange – Representation of dates and times.
定義該系列表示時間的屬性值，例如日期、時間或兩者的組合，需符合國際標準Data elements and interchange formats – Information interchange – Representation of dates and times
defines the range of attribute values expressing a temporal expression such as a date, a time, or a combination of them, that conform to the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes specification.
定義表示時間的屬性值範圍，如日期、時間或兩者的結合，依照W3CXML Schema Part 2: Datatypesspecification標準所定義。
defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value.
定義的屬性值範圍表示一個可能未知的真實值
defines the range of attribute values expressed as a single word or token.
定義的屬性值範圍表示一個單字或代號

defines the range of attribute values used to express a truth value which may be unknown.
定義的屬性值範圍表示一個可能未知的真實值
paragraph content
段落內容
defines the content of prose elements that are not used for transcription of extant materials.
定義散文元素的內容，該元素未用於轉錄現存資料
paragraph content
段落內容
defines the content of paragraphs and similar elements.
定義段落與類似元素的內容。
phrase sequence
詞組序列
defines a sequence of character data and phrase-level elements.
定義一連串文字資料與詞組層次元素。
limited phrase sequence
限定詞組序列
defines a sequence of character data and those phrase-level elements that are not typically used for transcribing extant documents.
定義一連串文字資料與詞組層次元素，通常不用於轉錄現存文件。
'special' paragraph content
「特殊」段落內容

defines the content model of elements such as notes or list items, which either contain a series of component-level elements or else have the same structure as a paragraph, containing a series of phrase-level and inter-level elements.
定義元素的內容模型，如註解或列表項目，這些內容模型包含一系列組合性層次元素，或與一個段落有相同的結構，包含一系列的詞組層次或inter-層次元素。
extended text
擴充文件
defines a sequence of character data and gaiji elements.
定義一連串文字資料與缺字元素。

records information about an application which has edited the TEI file.

Supplies an identifier for the application, independent of its version number or display name.

Supplies a version number for the application, independent of its identifier or display name.

row.cell: release authority
供應機構
supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making an electronic file available, other than a publisher or distributor.
說明除了出版者或發行者之外，負責提供電子檔案的個人或其他經銷商的名稱。
supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, etc.
提供關於文件可利用性的資訊，例如使用或發行上的任何限制、版權狀態等。
@status
supplies a code identifying the current availability of the text.
提供一個代號，用來確認文件目前的可利用性。
the text is freely available.
文件的可利用性不受限。
the status of the text is unknown.
文件狀態不明。
the text is not freely available.
文件的可利用性受限制。
fully-structured bibliographic citation
contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.
包含結構完整的書目資料，其中呈現出TEI檔案描述內的所有元件。
canonical reference pattern
定義如何將標準參照轉換成統一資源識別符 (URI) 。
specifies an expression and replacement pattern for transforming a canonical reference into a URI.
標明將標準參照轉換成統一資源識別符的表示方法與取代模式。
@matchPattern
specifies a regular expression against which the values of cRef attributes can be matched.
標明一個表示屬性cRef屬性值的固定方法。
@replacementPattern
specifies a replacement pattern which, once subpattern substitution has been performed, provides a URI.
標明一個取代模式，一旦進行次要模式的替換，會自動提供統一資源識別符 (URI) 。
category description
類目描述
describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.
描述分類法中或文件類型學中的某些類目，可用短文描述的型式，或是用TEI正式元素textDesc所使用的狀況參數。
category reference
類目參照
specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.
標明在某分類法或文件類型學中，一個或多個已定義之類目。
@target
identifies the categories concerned
標明相關的類目。
@scheme
identifies the classification scheme within which the set of categories concerned is defined
標明該分類架構，其中相關的類目群組已被定義
contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.
在使用者定義之分類法當中，此元素包含一項個別的描述性類目，該類目可能位於一個更上層的類目之中。
summarizes a particular change or correction made to a particular version of an electronic text which is shared between several researchers.
概述多位研究者共享的某版本電子文本當中，某特定的內容變更或修正。
@when
supplies the date of the change in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for supplies the date of the change in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.

contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.
包含文件在某標準分類系統中所屬的分類代碼。
@scheme
identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use.
說明使用中的分類系統或分類法。

分類宣告
contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.
包含一個或多個分類法，用來定義在文件中他處所使用之任何分類碼。

更正原則
states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.

@status
indicates the degree of correction applied to the text.
指出文本更正的程度。
the text has been thoroughly checked and proofread.
該文本以被徹底檢查校對過。
the text has been checked at least once.
該文本被檢查過至少一次。
the text has not been checked.
該文本從未被檢查過。
the correction status of the text is unknown.
更正狀態不明
@method
indicates the method adopted to indicate corrections within the text.
說明標示更正所採取的方法。
corrections have been made silently
直接在文本中更正
corrections have been represented using markup

cell.hi: No zh-tw for corrections have been represented using markup

describes a particular style or hand distinguished within a manuscript.
描述在手稿中可明顯辨識出的特殊風格或書寫手法。

@eol
end-of-line
indicates whether or not end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in a text.
指出行末連字符號是否在文本中被保留。
all end-of-line hyphenation has been retained, even though the lineation of the original may not have been.
保留所有行末連字符號，即使原文中的不被保留。
end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in some cases.
行末連字符號在某些情況下被保留。
all soft end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining end-od-line hyphenation should be retained.
所有軟音的行末連字符號皆被移除：任何剩下的行末連字符號應該被保留。
all end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining hyphenation occurred within the line.
所有行末連字符號皆被移除：剩下的是行中出現的行末連字符號。

表明編碼的種類，例如國際標準書號 (ISBN) 或其他標準系列編碼。
describes the scope of any analytic or interpretive information added to the text in addition to the transcription.

contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.

identifies the controlled vocabulary within which the set of keywords concerned is defined.

語言使用

個別敘述文本中使用的語言或次要語言。

identifier
Supplies a language code constructed as defined in BCP 47 which is used to identify the language documented by this element, and which is referenced by the global xml:lang attribute.
提供一語言代碼，其編碼方式定義在RFC 3066中 (或其系列中) ，用來識別此元素所紀錄的語言，並由全域屬性xml:lang所參照。
@usage
specifies the approximate percentage (by volume) of the text which uses this language.
標明該文本使用此語言的大約比例 (以冊計) 。
supplies the formal name of the namespace to which the elements documented by its children belong.
提供其子元素所描述的元素所屬的名稱空間之正式名稱。
@name
the full formal name of the namespace concerned.
名稱空間的正式完整名稱。
indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.
指出來源文件轉換成電子文本時規格化或標準化的程度。
@source
indicates the authority for any normalization carried out.
指出任何規格化所實行的依據。

提供文件非書目性方面的細節描述，特別是所使用的語言及次要語言、在何種情況下製作、參與人員及其環境背景。

計畫描述

cell.hi: No zh-tw for with unique identifier

row.cell: specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text which bear a distinct value for the global xml:id attribute.
指出帶有明確全域屬性xml:id屬性值的元素在文本中的出現次數。
@render
specifies the identifier of a rendition element which defines how this element is to be rendered.
標明元素rendition的識別符號，該符號定義此元素的呈現方法。
tagging declaration
標誌宣告
provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.
提供關於應用在XML文件中的標誌的詳細資訊。
defines a typology used to classify texts either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.
定義文件分類的類型學，可以是潛在地以書目資料的方式，或是明確地以結構分類法的方式來分類。
TEI Header
TEI標頭
supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text.
在所有符合TEI標準的文本起始的電子題名頁當中提供敘述性以及宣告性的資訊。
@type
specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, for example whether it is a corpus or individual text.
標明標頭所附屬於的文件類型，例如文集或單一文本。
the header is attached to a single text.
標頭附屬於單一文本中。
the header is attached to a corpus.
標頭附屬於文集中。
text classification
文件分類
groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.
匯集以標準分類架構、索引典等來描述文件性質或主題的資訊。
title statement
題名陳述
groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its intellectual content.
匯集關於作品標題與作品智慧內容責任歸屬的資訊。

div.head: [core] Elements common to all TEI documents

row.cell: abbreviation
縮寫
contains an abbreviation of any sort.
包含任何形式的縮寫。
@type
allows the encoder to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology.
標記者可以用合宜的分類方法將縮寫形式分類。
the abbreviation provides the first letter(s) of the word or phrase, omitting the remainder.
僅提供字詞開端的一個或一個以上的字母，並省略其他部分的縮寫形式。
the abbreviation omits some letter(s) in the middle.
省略單字當中某些字母的縮寫形式。
the abbreviation comprises a special symbol or mark.
包含特殊符號或標記的縮寫形式。
the abbreviation includes writing above the line.
包含上標文字的縮寫形式。
the abbreviation comprises the initial letters of the words of a phrase.
僅包含一詞組當中字首字母的縮寫形式。
the abbreviation is for a title of address (Dr, Ms, Mr, …)
用於頭銜稱呼的縮寫 (Dr, Ms, Mr, …)。
the abbreviation is for the name of an organization.
用於機構團體名稱的縮寫。
the abbreviation is for a geographic name.
用於地理名稱的縮寫。
addition
插入
contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
包含由作者、抄寫者、註解者、或更正者在文本中插入的字母、單字或詞彙。
address line
contains one line of a postal address.
包含郵寄地址或其他地址其的一行。
contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.
包含出版者、機構、或是個人的郵寄地址或其他地址。
analytic level
分析層書目
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.
包含某一項目 (例如詩或文章) 的書目元素，該項目並非獨立出版品，而是刊登在專題著作或是期刊當中。
in a bibliographic reference, contains the name of the author(s), personal or corporate, of a work; the primary statement of responsibility for any bibliographic item.
在書目參照中，包含一件作品的作者 (群) 姓名，無論是個人或是團體性質；這也是書目項目責任歸屬的主要陳述。
bibliographic citation
書目資料
contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.
包含結構零散的書目資料，其中次要元件不一定會明確標記。
scope of citation
書目引用範圍
defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.
標明書目參照資訊的範圍，例如標示頁碼列表、或是某著作的分支作品名稱。
@type
identifies the type of information conveyed by the element, e.g. pages, volume.
標明該元素所表達的資訊類型，例如頁、 冊。
volume
該元素標記的內容為冊號。
the element contains a volume number.
該元素標記的內容為冊號。
the element contains an issue number, or volume and issue numbers.
該元素標記的內容為一期刊號或冊號與期刊號。
pages
該元素標記的內容為一頁數或頁數範圍。
the element contains a page number or page range.
該元素標記的內容為一頁數或頁數範圍。
chapter
the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)

cell.hi: No zh-tw for the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)

row.cell: the element identifies a part of a book or collection.
該元素標明的內容為單書或集合作品的一部份。
structured bibliographic citation
結構次要書目
contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic sub-elements appear and in a specified order.
包含僅出現子節點的結構書目資料，並以特定順序呈現。
provides encoded binary data representing an inline graphic or other object.
標記用來表示文本中圖檔或其他檔案的二進位資料。
@width
The display width of the object
檔案顯示的寬度
@height
The display height of the object
檔案顯示的高度
@scale
A scale factor to be applied to the object to make it the desired display size
用來調整檔案顯示大小的比例係數
@encoding
The encoding used to encode the binary data. If not specified, this is assumed to be Base64.
標記該二進位資料時所使用到的編碼。若未特別指明，則假定為使用Base64編碼
column break
分段
marks the boundary between one column of a text and the next in a standard reference system.
用標準參照系統來標明文本段落之間的分界。
@ed
edition
indicates the edition or version in which the column break is located at this point
指出該分段位於哪一版本
groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.
匯集文件中對於同一部分文字所有可供替換的不同標記。
cited quotation

contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example.
從其他文件中引用的內容，並包含引用來源的書目參照資料。
correction
更正
contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.
包含文本中看似錯誤並加以更正過後的文字。
contains a date in any format.
包含任何格式的日期表示。
@calendar
indicates the system or calendar to which the date belongs.
指明該日期表示所使用的曆法計算系統。
Gregorian calendar
格里高里曆
Julian calendar
凱撒曆
Islamic or Muslim (hijri) lunar calendar
伊斯蘭或穆斯林 (哈吉來) 陽曆
Hebrew or Jewish lunisolar calendar
希伯來或猶太陰陽曆
French Revolutionary calendar
法國共和曆
Iranian or Persian (Jalaali) solar calendar
伊朗或波斯 (Jalaali) 陽曆
Coptic or Alexandrian calendar
埃及古曆或亞歷山大曆
Chinese lunisolar calendar
中國陰陽曆
deletion
刪除
contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
標記在文本中，由作者、抄寫者、註解者、或更正者刪除、標上刪除記號、或者標明為多餘或偽造的字母或單字。
description
contains a brief description of the intended usage, purpose, or application of its parent element.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for contains a brief description of the intended usage, purpose, or application of its parent element.

row.cell: identifies any word or phrase which is regarded as linguistically distinct, for example as archaic, technical, dialectal, non-preferred, etc., or as forming part of a sublanguage.
標明被視為特殊用語的字詞，例如：古語、專業用語、方言、非推薦用語等，或標明形成部分次要語言的字詞
@type
specifies the sublanguage or register to which the word or phrase is being assigned
指明所標記的字詞屬於哪一種次要語言或語體層次
@time
specifies how the phrase is distinct diachronically
指明該字詞是屬於哪一種時間上的特殊用語
@space
specifies how the phrase is distinct diatopically
指明該字詞是屬於哪一種區域上的特殊用語
@social
specifies how the phrase is distinct diastatically
指明該字詞是屬於哪一種社會層次分類上的特殊用語
automatically generated text division
自動產生的文字區段
indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.
指出文件處理軟體運作下自動產生的文字區段所出現的位置。
@type
specifies what type of generated text division (e.g. index, table of contents, etc.) is to appear.
具體指明何種文字區段 (如索引、目錄等) 會出現。
an index is to be generated and inserted at this point.
索引會產生並置入於此處
table of contents
目錄
a table of contents
目錄
figure list
圖表列表
a list of figures
圖表列表
table list
表格列表
a list of tables
表格列表
secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.
書目項目的次要責任歸屬，例如扮演編輯、編譯、翻譯等角色的個人、機構或組織 (或其他類似者) 的名稱。
@role
specifies the nature of the intellectual responsibility
具體說明智慧責任的性質
electronic mail address
contains an e-mail address identifying a location to which e-mail messages can be delivered.
包含一個電子郵件位址，標明電子郵件訊息可傳送的位置。
emphasized
強調
marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect.
為了語言上或修辭上的效果而加重語氣或特別強調的字句。
expansion
縮寫還原
contains the expansion of an abbreviation.
包含一個縮寫詞的還原形式。
foreign
外文
identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text.
標明所屬語言不同於週遭文字的字詞。

indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.
指出轉錄時被省略部分的位置，省略也許是出於 TEI標頭裡描述的編輯上的理由、也許是因為抽樣轉錄而省略、或是因為資料不明難以辨認或聽懂。
@reason
gives the reason for omission. Sample values include sampling, illegible, inaudible, irrelevant, cancelled, illegible.
說明省略的原因。屬性值的例子有sampling、illegible、inaudible、irrelevant、cancelled、cancelled and illegible。
@hand
in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand, signifies the hand which made the deletion.
若省略的內容是被身分明確的抄寫員由轉錄當中刻意刪除，則在此表明抄寫員的身分。
@agent
In the case of text omitted because of damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.
若省略是由於內容遭受損毀，且可識別損毀原因，則針對損毀原因加以分類。
damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
損毀起因於書頁邊緣摩擦受損
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface
損毀起因於書頁表面發霉
damage results from smoke
損毀起因於煙燻
@extent

indicates approximately how much text has been omitted from the transcription (using the unit specified on the unit attribute), either because of editorial policy or because a deletion, damage, or other cause has rendered transcription impossible.
約略指出在轉錄當中省略的文字量，可用字母數、公釐、英吋、或其他適當的單位來表示。省略可能是出於編輯策略、來源文本中的刪除、損毀、或其他因素而導致無法轉錄。
@unit
names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap

cell.hi: No zh-tw for names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap

row.cell: lines of text

cell.hi: No zh-tw for lines of text

row.cell: characters
characters of text

cell.hi: No zh-tw for characters of text

row.cell: pages, i.e. one side of a leaf

cell.hi: No zh-tw for pages, i.e. one side of a leaf

row.cell: centimetres
millimetres
inches
identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.

row.cell: @target
identifies the associated term element by an absolute or relative URI reference

cell.hi: No zh-tw for identifies the associated term element by an absolute or relative URI reference

row.cell: @cRef
canonical reference
identifies the associated term element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

cell.hi: No zh-tw for identifies the associated term element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

row.cell: indicates the location of an inline graphic, illustration, or figure.
指出文字文件中內含的圖形、插圖、或圖表的位置。
@width
The display width of the image
圖片顯示的寬度
@height
The display height of the image
圖片顯示的高度
@scale
A scale factor to be applied to the image to make it the desired display size
用來調整圖片顯示大小的比例係數
@url
uniform resource locator

cell.hi: No zh-tw for uniform resource locator

row.cell: A URL which refers to the image itself.
目標統一資源識別符
heading
標題
contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.
包含任何種類的標題，如章節、列表、詞彙表、寫本描述等的標題。
heading for list items
列表項目的標題
contains the heading for the item or gloss column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
包含詞彙列表或結構類似的列表中項目或註解欄位的標題。
heading for list labels
列表標籤的標題
contains the heading for the label or term column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
包含詞彙列表或結構類似的列表中標籤或專有名詞欄位的標題。
highlighted
顯目標示
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.
標誌其字型外觀上和週遭文字有所區別的字詞，但不指出顯目原因。
groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
匯集書目項目的出版或發行相關資訊。
index entry
索引項目
marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose.
標誌一個因某種目的而被索引的位置。
@indexName
supplies a name to specify which index (of several) the index entry belongs to.
提供該索引項目所屬索引名稱。
contains one component of a list.
包含列表中的一個項目。
verse line
詩行
contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.
包含詩文的一行，也許是不完整的詩行。
@part
specifies whether or not the line is metrically complete.
說明詩行的韻律表現是否完整。
yes
韻律表現不完整的詩行
the line is metrically incomplete
韻律表現不完整的詩行
no
詩行完整或未說明其完整性
either the line is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness
詩行完整或未說明其完整性
initial
不完整詩行的起始部分
the initial part of an incomplete line
不完整詩行的起始部分
medial
不完整詩行的中段部分
a medial part of an incomplete line
不完整詩行的中段部分
final
不完整詩行的末端部分
the final part of an incomplete line
不完整詩行的末端部分
contains the label associated with an item in a list; in glossaries, marks the term being defined.
包含和列表中某項目相關聯的標號；在詞彙表中則用來標記被定義的字詞。
line break
分行
marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.
標記某版本文本裡 (在印刷上) 的新起行。
@ed
edition
indicates the edition or version in which the line break is located at this point
指出該分行位於哪一個版本
line group
行組
contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
包含形式上視為一組的詩行，例如詩節、疊句、韻文段落等。
contains any sequence of items organized as a list.
包含以列表方式呈現的任何連續項目。
@type
describes the form of the list.
描述列表的形式。
list items are numbered or lettered.
列表項目以數字或字母依順序排列。
list items are marked with a bullet or other typographic device.
列表項目以黑點或其他印刷符號排列。
list items are not numbered or bulleted.
列表項目的排列沒有用數字或任何其他符號作標記。
each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.
各列表項目為一些字詞或概念下註解，每個項目之前並帶有標籤元素。
citation list
書目列表
contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.
包含任何種類的書目資料列表。
contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.
包含用來表示某物品數量的字詞，通常是由數字、單位和物品名稱所組成。
@type
specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.
用任何適合的分類方法來說明度量的種類。
measure group
contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.

row.cell: contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.
在書目參照當中，標記該書目項目來源的會議相關描述。
marks words or phrases mentioned, not used.
標明被提及但意義上未被使用的字句。
marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, as indicated by changes in a standard reference system, where the section is not represented by a structural element.
標明文本中由標準參照系統變更所指示的任何區塊分界點，並且該章節未以任何結構性元素標記。
@ed
edition
indicates the edition or version to which the milestone applies.
指出該分界位於哪一版本。
@unit
provides a conventional name for the kind of section changing at this milestone.
提供此分界段落所使用的通用單位名稱。
physical page breaks (synonymous with the pb element).
分頁 (和元素pb同義) 。
column breaks.
分段。
line breaks (synonymous with the lb element).
分行 (和元素lb同義) 。
any units termed book, liber, etc.
所有稱為書、冊、或函等的單位。
individual poems in a collection.
詩集中的單首詩。
cantos or other major sections of a poem.
長詩的詩篇，或詩的大段落。
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto.
一首詩、一本書、或一詩篇中的詩節。
acts within a play.
劇本中的幕。
scenes within a play or act.
劇本中的景。
sections of any kind.
任何種類的段落。
passages not present in the reference edition.
該段文字未在參照版本中出現。
monographic level
專題層書目
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).
包含某一項目 (例如書或期刊) 的書目元素， 該項目為一獨立出版品 (即未附屬於其他出版品) 。
name, proper noun
名稱，特定名稱
contains a proper noun or noun phrase.
包含一個特定名稱 或名詞詞組。
@type
indicates the type of the object which is being named by the phrase.
說明該名稱所表示項目的種類。
contains a note or annotation.
包含附註或註釋。
@type
describes the type of note.
說明附註的種類。
@resp
responsible party
indicates who is responsible for the annotation: author, editor, translator, etc.
指出該註釋的責任歸屬者：作者、編者或譯者等。
@anchored
indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.
說明文本是否顯示附註的確切參照位置。
@target
indicates the point (or points) of attachment for a note, or the beginning of the span to which the note is attached.
指出一個 (或數個) 附註的所註點，或是所註範圍的起點。
@targetEnd
points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.
如果附註不是嵌在正文中，則用以標明附註所註範圍的終點。
number
數字
contains a number, written in any form.
包含一個以任何形式呈現的數字。
@type
indicates the type of numeric value.
指出數值的種類。
absolute number, e.g. 21, 21.5
ordinal number, e.g. 21st
序數，例如第21
fraction, e.g. one half or three-quarters
分數，例如二分之一或是四分之三
a percentage
百分比
@value
supplies the value of the number in standard form.
用標準形式來說明該數字所代表的值。
original form
原文格式
contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.
標誌原文中呈現的文字，並且未經過任何修改或規格化處理。
paragraph
段落
marks paragraphs in prose.
標記散文的段落。
page break
分頁
marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system.
以標準參照系統來標記頁與頁之間的分界線。
@ed
edition
indicates the edition or version in which the page break is located at this point
指出該分頁位於哪一版本
postal box or post office box
郵政信箱
contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address.
包含一個數字或其他識別名稱，標示街道地址之外的郵件寄送點。
postal code
郵遞區號
contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.
包含一個數字或字母加數字的區域代碼，屬於郵寄地址的一部分，用以簡化郵件的分類及寄送工作。
pointer
defines a pointer to another location.
標明一個與其他位置相連結的指標。
@target
specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying one or more URI References
提供一個或多個統一資源識別符參照 (URI References) 來具體說明指標所指的位置。
@cRef
canonical reference
specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
用元素refsDecl在TEI標頭內所定義的標準參照來說明指標所指位置。
publication place
contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.
包含書目項目的出版地名稱。
provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
提供負責出版或發行書目項目的機構名稱。
separated from the surrounding text with quotation marks
引用的言詞、思想、或文字

contains material which is marked as (ostensibly) being somehow different than the surrounding text, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.
包含標記為 (看似) 引用自他處的內容；在敘述文中，此元素用來標記直接或間接敘述；在字典中，用來標記實例或編者設計的範例；在寫本描述或其他上層資訊中，用來標記由來源文本中所摘錄的引文。
@type
may be used to indicate whether the offset passage is spoken or thought, or to characterize it more finely.
可用來指出引文內容為言詞或思想，或者做更詳細的引文描述。
representation of speech
表示直接敘述，通常會標上引號。
representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue
表示思考內容，例如內心獨白。
quotation from a written source
引用自一份書面來源文件。
authorial distance
foreign words
linguistically distinct
technical term
rhetorically emphasized
refering to itself, not its normal referant

cell.hi: No zh-tw for refering to itself, not its normal referant

row.cell: quotation
引文
contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.
包含敘述者或作者引用自文本以外來源的字 (句) 詞或段落。
reference
defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.
標明與其他位置互相參照的符號，或許包含附加的文字或註解。
@target
specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References
用一個或多個統一資源識別符參照 (URI References) 來說明參照所指位置。
@cRef
canonical reference
specifies the destination of the reference by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header
用元素refsDecl在TEI標頭內所定義的標準參照來說明參照所指位置。
regularization
一般化
contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.
標誌一般化或規格化處理過的文字。
contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.
包含或參照到其他書目項目，該些項目與目前的書目項目在某種程度上相關，例如作為其組成或者替代項目。
responsibility
contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.
包含一個詞彙，來描述個人智慧責任的類型。
statement of responsibility
責任陳述
supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply.
當未使用作者、編輯者等特定元素，或元素內容不足時，在此補充說明文件、版本、記錄、或是叢書的智慧內容所屬負責人的責任陳述。
referencing string
參照字串
contains a general purpose name or referring string.
包含一般名稱或參照字串。
@type
indicates more specifically the object referred to by the referencing string. Values might include person, place, ship, element etc.
更詳細指出參照字串所表示的對象。屬性值可包含person、place、ship、element等
speech or thought

cell.hi: No zh-tw for speech or thought

row.cell: indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.

row.cell: @aloud
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.

row.cell: @direct
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.

row.cell: series information
叢書資訊
contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.
包含某書目項目所屬的叢書資訊。
latin for thus or so
contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.
包含看似錯誤但仍照實轉錄的文本。
contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics.
作者或敘述者使用的字句在意義上另有所指的表現，例如諷刺所使用的引號或斜體標示。
speech
演說
An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.
劇本中的個人台詞，或散文、韻文中的個人演說。
A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.
一種特殊的標題或標籤形式，用來標示劇本中一位或多位講者名稱。
stage direction
舞台指示
contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.
包含劇本中任何一種舞台場景或演出動作指示。
@type
indicates the kind of stage direction.
指出舞台指示的種類。
describes a setting.
描述舞台佈景。
describes an entrance.
描述角色進場。
describes an exit.
描述角色退場。
describes stage business.
描述演員動作。
is a narrative, motivating stage direction.
敘述性的，積極性的舞台指示。
describes how a character speaks.
描述演員說話方式。
gives some detail about a character.
提供一個角色的某些細節資訊。
describes a location.
描述場景位置。
more than one of the above
包含兩種以上的舞台指示類型。
a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.
完整的街道地址，包含任何名稱或數字，用以識別一棟建築物以及所在街道名稱。
contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text.
包含一套用TEI編碼的文件集，由單一文集標頭以及一個 (或多個) TEI元素所組成，各TEI元素包含單一文本標頭和一個文本。
@version
The version of the TEI scheme
TEI架構的版本
contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.
包含作為專有名詞的一個單字、詞彙、或是表示符號。
@target
identifies the associated gloss element by an absolute or relative URI reference

cell.hi: No zh-tw for identifies the associated gloss element by an absolute or relative URI reference

row.cell: @cRef
identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

cell.hi: No zh-tw for identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header

row.cell: @sortKey
supplies the sort key for this term in an index.
提供索引中該專有名詞的排序關鍵。
contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.
包含一組字詞，以任何形式定義時間
contains the full title of a work of any kind.
包含任何種類作品的完整題名。
@level
indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.
指出題名的書目層次，即該題名之所指可以是文章、書籍、期刊、叢書或未出版的項目。
analytic
分析層題名 (文章、詩、或其他隸屬於一個較大作品的項目)
analytic title (article, poem, or other item published as part of a larger item)
分析層題名 (文章、詩、或其他隸屬於一個較大作品的項目)
monographic
專題層題名 (書、選集、或其他獨立出版的項目，包含多冊作品的其中一冊)
monographic title (book, collection, or other item published as a distinct item, including single volumes of multi-volume works)
專題層題名 (書、選集、或其他獨立出版的項目，包含多冊作品的其中一冊)
journal
期刊層題名
journal title
期刊層題名
series
叢書層題名
series title
叢書層題名
unpublished
未出版的項目題名 (包括未經商業刊物發表的專題論文)
title of unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)
未出版的項目題名 (包括未經商業刊物發表的專題論文)
@type
classifies the title according to some convenient typology.
用合適的分類方法將題名分類。
main title
主要題名
subordinate
副題名、部分題名
subtitle, title of part
副題名、部分題名
alternate
替代題名，通常以該作品著名的另一種語言呈現
alternate title, often in another language, by which the work is also known
替代題名，通常以該作品著名的另一種語言呈現
abbreviated form of title
題名的縮寫形式
descriptive
該作品的描述性改述，可作為題名
descriptive paraphrase of the work functioning as a title
該作品的描述性改述，可作為題名
contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.
在來源文本中難以辨認或聽懂而無法確實轉錄的單字、詞組、或段落。
@reason
indicates why the material is hard to transcribe.
指出資料難以轉錄的原因。
@hand
Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.
若轉錄困難是由身分明確的執行者所造成 (例如部分刪除)，則在此表明執行者的身分。
@agent
Where the difficulty in transcription arises from damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.
若因為內容遭受損毀而引起轉錄困難，且可辨別出損毀的導因，則在此加以說明。
damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges
損毀起因於書頁邊緣摩擦受損
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface
損毀起因於書頁表面發霉
damage results from smoke
損毀起因於煙燻
TEI document
TEI文件
contains a single TEI-conformant document, comprising a TEI header and a text, either in isolation or as part of a teiCorpus element.
包含符合TEI標準的單一文件，由一個TEI標頭及一份文本組成，可單獨出現或是作為元素teiCorpus的一部分。
@version
The version of the TEI scheme
TEI架構的版本
A formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.
規則列表或文字敘述，說明文本分段內容包含的主題。
back matter
正文後資訊
contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.
在正文之後，包含附錄等。
text body
正文
contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.
單篇文章的整體部分，不包含正文前及正文後資訊。
contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.
包含作品的主要責任陳述，出現在題名頁或作品開頭或結尾處。
groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.
匯集日期地點、署名、稱呼語、及其他在區段結尾出現的類似措辭，尤指信件結尾。
contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer.
包含簡短的地點、日期及時間等的描述，通常出現在信件、報紙文章、或其他作品中的開頭或結尾，作為一種標頭或結尾。
text division
文本區段
contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文、及正文後資訊的分段。
level-1 text division
區段層次一
contains a first-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第一層分段 (若未使用區段層次零，區段層次一是最高層的分段。若使用區段層次零，則區段層次一為第二層分段) 。
level-2 text division
區段層次二
contains a second-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第二層分段。
level-3 text division
區段層次三
contains a third-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第三層分段。
level-4 text division
區段層次四
contains a fourth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第四層分段。
level-5 text division
區段層次五
contains a fifth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第五層分段。
level-6 text division
區段層次六
contains a sixth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第六層分段。
level-7 text division
區段層次七
contains the smallest possible subdivision of the front, body or back of a text, larger than a paragraph.
文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的最低層分段，分段層級高於段落。
document author
文件作者
contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).
包含文件作者名稱，同於題名頁上顯示的作者名 (經常但不一定出現在署名當中) 。
document date
文件日期
contains the date of a document, as given (usually) on a title page.
包含文件日期， 同於 (通常) 在題名頁上顯示的日期。
@when
gives the value of the date in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for gives the value of the date in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.

row.cell: document edition
文件版本
contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.
包含一份版本陳述，與文件題名頁所顯示的相同。
document imprint
文件出版說明
contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.
包含文件出版陳述 (出版日期、地點以及出版公司名稱) ，同於 (通常) 題名頁尾所顯示的出版資訊。
document title
文件題名
contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.
包含文件題名，包含所有組成部分，同於題名頁上所顯示的題名。
contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start of a section or chapter, or on a title page.
包含一段匿名或署名引文，出現在段落或章節的開頭，或在題名頁中。
contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, which interrupts the text containing it at any point and after which the surrounding text resumes.
包含一份任何種類的文本，無論是單一或複合的，該份文本任意穿插於整體文本中，而週遭文字則接續其後。
front matter
正文前資訊
contains any prefatory matter (headers, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.
包含位於文件最前端、正文之前的項目 (標頭、題名頁、前言、獻詞等) 。

contains the body of a composite text, grouping together a sequence of distinct texts (or groups of such texts) which are regarded as a unit for some purpose, for example the collected works of an author, a sequence of prose essays, etc.
包含複合文本的正文，所匯集的一連串單一文件 (或文件群組) ，因為某特殊目的被視為一個整體，例如一個作者的作品集合、一連串的散文集等。
contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.
包含作品出版的正式授權聲明，有時必須出現在題名頁或反頁上。
groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.
匯集日期地點、署名、稱呼語及其他在區段開端出現的類似措辭，尤指信件開頭。
contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.

row.cell: salutation
稱呼語
contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.
包含在序言、獻詞、或其他文本區段開頭的稱呼語或問候語，或是信件、引言等結尾處的致意詞。
signature
簽名
contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text.
包含結尾致意詞等，附加在序言、獻詞、或其他文本區段中。
contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.
包含一份任何種類的文本，無論是單一或複合的，例如詩詞或戲劇、散文集、小說、字典、或是文集範例。
title page
題名頁
contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter.
包含文本的題名頁，出現在正文前資訊或正文後資訊之中。
@type
classifies the title page according to any convenient typology.
將題名頁分類。
contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.
包含作品題名的部分或區段，同於題名頁上所標示的題名。
@type
specifies the role of this subdivision of the title.
說明該題名部分的作用。
main title of the work
作品主要題名
subordinate
作品次要題名
subtitle of the work
作品次要題名
alternate
作品代換題名
alternative title of the work
作品代換題名
abbreviated form of title
題名的縮寫形式
descriptive
作品的描述性改述
descriptive paraphrase of the work
作品的描述性改述
contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text.
包含文本中一個區段結束時的結尾題名或尾錄。
character
文字
provides descriptive information about a character.
提供一個文字的描述性資訊。
character declarations
文字描述
provides information about nonstandard characters and glyphs.
提供文字或字體的描述性資訊。
character name
文字名稱
contains the name of a character, expressed following Unicode conventions.
包含一文字名稱，其表示法根據統一碼協定 (Unicode)。
character property
文字性質
provides a name and value for some property of the parent character or glyph.
提供父文字或字體的性質名稱與性質值。
character or glyph
文字或字體
represents a non-standard character or glyph.
非標準的文字或字體。
@ref
points to a description of the character or glyph intended.
連結到該文字或字體的描述。
character glyph
文字的形體
provides descriptive information about a character glyph.
提供一種字體的描述性資訊。
character glyph name
字體名稱
contains the name of a glyph, expressed following Unicode conventions for character names.
包含一字體名稱，其表示法根據統一碼協定 (Unicode)。
locally-defined property name
當地定義的性質名稱
contains a locally defined name for some property.
包含某性質的地方性定義名稱。
character mapping
文字對應
contains one or more characters which are related to the parent character or glyph in some respect, as specified by the type attribute.
包含與父文字或字體在某方面有所關聯的一個或多個文字，在屬性type中加以說明。
unicode property name
統一碼性質名稱
contains the name of a registered Unicode normative or informative property.
包含一個統一碼規範性質之註冊名稱。
@version
specifies the version number of the Unicode Standard in which this property name is defined.
說明該性質名稱是定義在哪一版本的統一碼標準 (Unicode Standard) 中。
value
性質值
contains a single value for some property, attribute, or other analysis.
包含一個性質值、屬性值、或其他分析值。
enjambement
詩句跨行
groups elements bearing the enjamb attribute.
匯集帶有屬性enjamb的元素。
@enjamb
enjambement
indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.
指出詩行末端帶有詩句跨行的標記。
the line is end-stopped
該詩句在行尾結束
the line in question runs on into the next
該詩句延續到下一詩行
the line is weakly enjambed
詩句弱跨行
the line is strongly enjambed
詩句強跨行
defines a set of attributes which certain elements may use to represent metrical information.
定義一組特定元素所使用、表示詩行韻律的屬性。
@met

marks the point at which a metrical line may be divided.
標記韻律詩行可能被截斷的位置。
metrical notation declaration

documents the notation employed to represent a metrical pattern when this is specified as the value of a met, real, or rhyme attribute on any structural element of a metrical text (e.g. lg, l, or seg).
在標記韻文時所用到的結構性元素 (例如lg、l、或seg) 當中，若使用met、real、或rhyme等屬性的屬性值來表示文章的韻律模式，則在此宣告標記韻律模式的方法。
@type
indicates whether the notation conveys the abstract metrical form, its actual prosodic realization, or the rhyme scheme, or some combination thereof.
指出該標記所傳達的為抽象韻律形式、實際韻律實踐、或者押韻形式，或任幾項之結合。
met attribute
屬性met
declaration applies to the abstract metrical form recorded on the met attribute
屬性 met宣告適用於該屬性所紀錄的抽象韻律形式。
real attribute
屬性real
declaration applies to the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure recorded on the real attribute
屬性real宣告適用於該屬性所紀錄的通用韻律結構之實際實踐
rhyme attribute
declaration applies to the rhyme scheme recorded on the rhyme attribute

cell.hi: No zh-tw for declaration applies to the rhyme scheme recorded on the rhyme attribute

regular expression pattern

cell.hi: No zh-tw for regular expression pattern

row.cell: specifies a regular expression defining any value that is legal for this notation.
標明一種固定表示法，用來定義任何合用於此標記的屬性值。
metrical notation symbol
documents the intended significance of a particular character or character sequence within a metrical notation, either explicitly or in terms of other symbol elements in the same metDecl.
說明在標記韻律模式時使用的特定符號或符號序列所代表的意義，可以是明確的文字闡釋，或是加以解釋同ㄧ個韻律宣告中其他韻律符號元素的內容。
@value
specifies the character or character sequence being documented.
標明所紀錄的符號或符號序列。
@terminal
specifies whether the symbol is defined in terms of other symbols (terminal is set to false) or in prose (terminal is set to true).
標明該符號是否以其他符號來定義 (terminal為false) 或以散文描述 (terminal為true)
marks the rhyming part of a metrical line.
標記韻律詩行的押韻部分。
@label
provides a label to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string instantiates.
提供一個標籤，識別此韻腳為押韻組合的哪一部份。
Name of an actor appearing within a cast list.
角色名單中的演員姓名。
describes a particular camera angle or viewpoint in a screen play.
描述電影視劇本中攝影機的某特定視角或觀看角度。
contains the text of a caption or other text displayed as part of a film script or screenplay.
包含呈現在對白本或電影視劇本中的字幕或其他文字。
cast list grouping
角色群組
groups one or more individual castItem elements within a cast list.
匯集角色清單中一個或多個角色項目元素。
cast list item
角色項目
contains a single entry within a cast list, describing either a single role or a list of non-speaking roles.
包含角色清單中的一個項目，描述單一角色或無台詞角色的列表。
@type
characterizes the cast item.
說明角色項目的特性。
the item describes a single role.
該項目為單一角色
the item describes a list of non-speaking roles.
該項目為無台詞角色的列表
cast list
角色清單
contains a single cast list or dramatis personae.
包含單一角色名單或出場人物列表。
contains the epilogue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.
包含戲劇收場白，可能和特定演出或故事場景相關，一般是由一個演員脫離劇中身份來朗讀。
movement
動作
marks the actual entrance or exit of one or more characters on stage.
標記舞台上人物的實際進場或退場。
@type
characterizes the movement, for example as an entrance or exit.
說明舞台動作，例如進場或退場。
character is entering the stage.
角色進場
character is exiting the stage.
角色退場
character moves on stage

cell.hi: No zh-tw for character moves on stage

row.cell: @where
specifies the direction of a stage movement.
說明舞台動作的方向。
left
舞台左側
stage left
舞台左側
right
舞台右側
stage right
舞台右側
center
舞台中央
centre stage
舞台中央
@perf
performance
identifies the performance or performances in which this movement occurred as specified.
指明這項舞台動作出現在哪些演出中。
contains a section of front or back matter describing how a dramatic piece is to be performed in general or how it was performed on some specific occasion.
包含前頁或後頁部分，描述戲劇作品的一般演出方式、或曾經在某些特定場合的演出方式。
contains the prologue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.
包含戲劇開場白，可能和特定演出或故事場景相關，一般是由一個演員脫離劇中身份來朗讀。
the name of a dramatic role, as given in a cast list.
角色名單所列的劇中角色名稱。
role description
角色描述
describes a character's role in a drama.
描述劇中人物所扮演的角色。
setting
contains a description of the setting, time, locale, appearance, etc., of the action of a play, typically found in the front matter of a printed performance text (not a stage direction).
包含一段演出的場景描述，像是佈景、時間、地點、景象等，這段描述通常出現在劇本中的前頁部分 (並非舞台動作指示) 。
describes a sound effect or musical sequence specified within a screen play or radio script.
描述電影或廣播劇本中的音效或配樂。
@type
categorizes the sound in some respect, e.g. as music, special effect, etc.
將聲音從某方面來分類，例如音樂，特殊音效等。
@discrete
indicates whether the sound overlaps the surrounding speeches or interrupts them.
指出該聲音是否和週遭說話聲音重疊或單獨穿插於其間。
technical stage direction
技術性舞台指示
describes a special-purpose stage direction that is not meant for the actors.
描述一個具有特殊目的，但並非針對演員的舞台指示。
@type
categorizes the technical stage direction.
技術性舞台指示類型
a lighting cue
燈光提示
a sound cue
音效提示
a prop cue
道具提示
a blocking instruction
舞台調度指示
@perf
performance
identifies the performance or performances to which this technical direction applies.
指出該技術性舞台指示適用於哪些演出中。
describes the visual context of some part of a screen play in terms of what the spectator sees, generally independent of any dialogue.
劇本中描述觀眾所看到的景象，一般不包含任何對話內容。
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.
提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.
提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。
describes a broadcast used as the source of a spoken text.
描述口說文本的公開播送影音來源相關資訊。
provides technical details of the equipment and media used for an audio or video recording used as the source for a spoken text.
提供錄製設備及媒介的技術性細節，該設備及媒介用於口說文本來源之影像或聲音錄製。
any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.

row.cell: any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.
任何溝通現象，未必是口說表達，例如手勢、皺眉等。
@iterated
indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.
指出該現象是否重複發生。
a pause either between or within utterances.
說話之間或說話時的停頓。
recording event
影音錄製
details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast.
包含口說文本的影像或聲音來源錄製細節，該來源可以是直接錄製或是經由公開播放的管道取得。
@type
the kind of recording.
錄製類型
audio recording
聲音錄製
audio and video recording
聲音及影像錄製
recording statement
影音陳述
describes a set of recordings used as the basis for transcription of a spoken text.
當所轉錄的口說文本來源為影音檔案時，在此描述影音錄製的相關資訊。
script statement
腳本陳述
contains a citation giving details of the script used for a spoken text.
包含口說文本的來源腳本相關細節。
marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.
所標記的位置表示任一說話者在一連串說話中，某些附屬語言特性的改變。
@feature
a paralinguistic feature.
附屬語言特性
speed of utterance.
說話速度
loudness.
音量
pitch range.
音調範圍
tension or stress pattern.
張力或強調模式
rhythmic qualities.
節奏品質
voice quality.
聲音品質
@new
specifies the new state of the paralinguistic feature specified.
說明改變後的附屬語言特性狀況。
utterance
話語
a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.
一段言詞，通常在說話前後是一段沉默、或是另一個人的說話。
@trans
transition
indicates the nature of the transition between this utterance and the previous one.
指出此段話語和前段話語之間轉變過程的特性。
this utterance begins without unusual pause or rapidity.
此段話語的開頭並無異常停頓或異常迅速。
this utterance begins with a markedly shorter pause than normal.
此段話語開頭的停頓明顯比平常要短。
this utterance begins before the previous one has finished.
此段話語在前一段還未結束前就開始。
this utterance begins after a noticeable pause.
此段話語在一段明顯的停頓之後開始。
any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.
發出聲音但未必是詞彙的話語，例如有聲的停頓、非詞彙的附應等。
@iterated
indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.
指出該現象是否重複發生。
a passage of written text revealed to participants in the course of a spoken text.
在口說的過程中，參與者可觀看的一段書面文字。
@source
points to a bibliographic citation in the header giving a full description of the source or script of the writing.

cell.hi: No zh-tw for points to a bibliographic citation in the header giving a full description of the source or script of the writing.

indicates whether the writing is revealed all at once or gradually.

groups the different styles of dictionary entries.

@type
indicates type of entry, in dictionaries with multiple types.
指出複合類型字典中的辭條類型。
a main entry (default).
主要辭條 (預設) 。
homograph

groups information relating to one homograph within an entry.
個別的同形義異字辭條。
cross reference

a reduced entry whose only function is to point to another main entry (e.g. for forms of an irregular verb or for variant spellings: was pointing to be, or esthete to aesthete).

gives an expanded form of information presented more concisely in the dictionary

gives a normalized form of information given by the source text in a non-normalized form

@split

gives the original string or is the empty string when the element does not appear in the source text.
當該元素未出現於來源文件中，提供其原文字串或空白字串。
@location
provides a reference to an anchor element elsewhere in the document indicating the original location of this component.
參照到文件中的元素anchor，指出此元件的原文位置。

gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form.

within an entry in a dictionary or a terminological data file, contains grammatical information relating to a term, word, or form.
在字典辭條或專有名詞檔案中，包含某一術語、單字或字彙形式的相關文法資訊。
@type

classifies the grammatical information given according to some convenient typology — in the case of terminological information, preferably the dictionary of data element types specified in ISO WD 12 620.
用合適的分類方法將不同的文法資訊加以分類－若是專門術語，可參照 ISO WD 12620 所指定資料元素類別。
part of speech
詞性 (在已知語言中的詞性分類，根據字詞的形式、意義或特性組合而有所不同。例如名詞、動詞、形容詞等。)
any of the word classes to which a word may be assigned in a given language, based on form, meaning, or a combination of features, e.g. noun, verb, adjective, etc.
詞性 (在已知語言中的詞性分類，根據字詞的形式、意義或特性組合而有所不同。例如名詞、動詞、形容詞等。)
gender
性別 (名詞、代名詞、或伴隨的修飾詞透過這樣的規則系統在表現形式上被加以分組、或產生屈折變化，以展現特定的語法關係。)
formal classification by which nouns and pronouns, and often accompanying modifiers, are grouped and inflected, or changed in form, so as to control certain syntactic relationships
性別 (名詞、代名詞、或伴隨的修飾詞透過這樣的規則系統在表現形式上被加以分組、或產生屈折變化，以展現特定的語法關係。)
number
單複數 (例如單數、複數、雙數詞等)
grammatical number, e.g. singular, plural, dual, …
單複數 (例如單數、複數、雙數詞等)
animate or inanimate
活的或非活的
proper noun or common noun
特定名稱或一般名詞
grammatical information group
文法資訊群
groups morpho-syntactic information about a lexical item, e.g. pos, gen, number, case, or iType (inflectional class).
匯集文字的型態及句法資訊，例如詞性、性別、單複數、格、或屈折變化種類。
homograph
同形義異字
groups information relating to one homograph within an entry.
匯集辭條中一個同形義異字的相關資訊。
hyphenation
連字符號
contains a hyphenated form of a dictionary headword, or hyphenation information in some other form.
包含一個標題字的連字符號形式，或者以其他形式呈現的連字符號資訊。
inflectional class
屈折變化種類
indicates the inflectional class associated with a lexical item.
指明單字的屈折變化種類。
@type

indicates the type of indicator used to specify the inflection class, when it is necessary to distinguish between the usual abbreviated indications (e.g. inv) and other kinds of indicators, such as special codes referring to conjugation patterns, etc.
若需要區別曲折變化種類的一般縮寫指標 (例：inv) 以及其他指標，像是詞形變化模式的特殊代碼等，則在此說明指示標記類型。
abbreviated indicator
縮寫指標
coded reference to a table of verbs
動詞表的編碼參照
language name
語言名稱
name of a language mentioned in etymological or other linguistic discussion.
在詞源學或其他語言學相關訊息中所提到的語言。
label
標籤
contains a label for a form, example, translation, or other piece of information, e.g. abbreviation for, contraction of, literally, approximately, synonyms:, etc.
包含字詞形式、範例、翻譯、或其他資訊的標籤，例如縮寫、省略、字面、約略、同義等。
@type
classifies the label using any convenient typology.
用合適的分類方法將標籤分類。
contains information about the grammatical mood of verbs (e.g. indicative, subjunctive, imperative).
包含動詞語氣資訊 (例如直述、假設、祈使語氣等) 。
indicates grammatical number associated with a form, as given in a dictionary.
指出單複數形式。
orthographic-form reference
拼字參照
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to the orthographic form(s) of the headword.
在字典範例中，參照出標題字的拼字形式。
@type
indicates the kind of typographic modification made to the headword in the reference.
指出為參照出標題字所做的印刷修飾。
capital
首字母大寫
indicates first letter is given as capital
首字母大寫
no hyphen
indicates that the headword, though a prefix or suffix, loses its hyphen

cell.hi: No zh-tw for indicates that the headword, though a prefix or suffix, loses its hyphen

row.cell: orthographic-variant reference
拼字變化參照
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to variant orthographic form(s) of the headword.
在字典範例中，參照出標題字的拼字變化形式。
@type
indicates the kind of variant involved.
指出變化種類。
past tense
過去式
past participle
過去分詞
present participle
現在分詞
feminine
陰性
plural
多數
orthographic form
拼字形式
gives the orthographic form of a dictionary headword.
提供字典標題字的拼字形式。
@type
gives the type of spelling.
提供拼字的類型。
@extent
gives the extent of the orthographic information provided.
顯示拼字資訊的完整程度。
full form
完整形式
prefix
字首
suffix
字尾
partial
部分
pronunciation reference
發音參照
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to the pronunciation(s) of the headword.
在字典範例中，參照出標題字的發音形式。
pronunciation-variant reference
發音變化參照
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to variant pronunciation(s) of the headword.
在字典範例中，參照出標題字的發音變化形式。
person
人稱
contains an indication of the grammatical person (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.) associated with a given inflected form in a dictionary.
包含字典中有屈折變化單字的人稱形式 (第一、第二、第三等) 。
part of speech
詞性
indicates the part of speech assigned to a dictionary headword such as noun, verb, or adjective.
指明標題字的詞性 (名詞、動詞、形容詞等)
pronunciation
發音
contains the pronunciation(s) of the word.
包含該字的一種或多種發音方法。
@extent
indicates whether the pronunciation is for whole word or part.
指出該發音為完整或部分發音。
full form
完整形式
prefix
字首
suffix
字尾
partial
部分
@notation
indicates what notation is used for the pronunciation, if more than one occurs in the machine-readable dictionary.
若機讀詞典中出現一個以上的發音記號，在此指出用於該發音的記號。
related entry
相關辭條
contains a dictionary entry for a lexical item related to the headword, such as a compound phrase or derived form, embedded inside a larger entry.
和標題字相關聯的字典辭條，像是包括在一個更大辭條中的複合片語或衍生字。
groups together all information relating to one word sense in a dictionary entry, for example definitions, examples, and translation equivalents.
匯集辭條中一個字義的所有相關資訊(定義、範例、翻譯等)。
@level
gives the nesting depth of this sense.
說明該字義在辭條中的層次。
contains the stress pattern for a dictionary headword, if given separately.
包含個別標明的標題字重音模式。
subcategorization
次要分類
contains subcategorization information (transitive/intransitive, countable/non-countable, etc.)
包含次要分類資訊 (及物 / 不及物、可數 / 不可數等)
groups successive entries for a set of homographs.
匯集一組同形異義字的連續辭條。
syllabification
音節劃分
contains the syllabification of the headword.
包含標題字的音節劃分。
tense
時態
indicates the grammatical tense associated with a given inflected form in a dictionary.
說明某屈折形式的時態。
usage
字詞使用資訊
contains usage information in a dictionary entry.
包含辭條中的使用資訊。
@type
classifies the usage information using any convenient typology.
用合適的分類方法將不同的使用資訊分類。
geographic
地理範圍
geographic area
地理範圍
temporal, historical era (archaic, old, etc.)
不同時期、歷史年代 (古體、老式等。)
domain
地域

地域
register
語域
語域
style (figurative, literal, etc.)
語體 (象徵性、字面原義等)

優先程度 (主要、慣用等)
preference level (chiefly, usually, etc.)
優先程度 (主要、慣用等)
language
語言 (外來文字、拼音、發音等的語言)
name of a language mentioned in etymological or other linguistic discussion.
語言 (外來文字、拼音、發音等的語言)
grammatical
文法上的使用
grammatical usage
文法上的使用

同義詞
synonym given to show use
同義詞

上層文字
hypernym given to show usage
上層文字
collocation
組合字
contains a collocate of the headword.
組合字
complement
典型補語
typical complement
典型補語
object
典型受詞
typical object
典型受詞

典型主詞

典型主詞
